We need to infer from class description: CommandFramework is a simple command line framework inspired by nox. It uses argparse, each function annotated with an instance becomes a subcommand. Options shared across commands, defined via kwargs when creating instance. Options only defined for commands with matching parameter. Kwarg name is option name, prefixed with '--', underscores to dashes. Value passed as kwargs to add_argument. Passing None results in internal only parameter. Custom kwargs recognized: name (override positional argument), exclusive (exclusive group). Methods: __call__, __init__, _format_command_name, _run, main, run.

We need to produce summary: high-level description of class responsibility and behavior.

Business intent: purpose for business: provide a lightweight command line interface framework for defining subcommands via function annotations, handling shared options, parsing arguments, executing commands.

Keywords: command line, framework, argparse, subcommands, options, decorator, CLI, parsing, exclusive group, shared options, function annotation.

Now produce JSON.

Make sure no method names verbatim? The constraint: Do NOT list method names verbatim. So we shouldn't list method names in summary or keywords. That's fine.

Business intent: "Enable developers to quickly create consistent CLI tools without manually configuring argparse for each command, improving maintainability and reducing boilerplate."
